structure.unit: Courts, Judicial Officers And Proceedings In Civil Cases

law.catch_line: Witness In Multiple Criminal Cases; Apportionment Of Fees
law.text: If witnesses are in attendance in two or more criminal cases pending at the same time before the same court, they shall not be allowed full travel and attendance in each case, but the justice or clerk of the court may reduce and apportion the same, allowing at least one travel and attendance.
